website_summaries.verdict: A super-lightweight solar panel with a bit of flex, making it easy to set up. But the solar cells are prone to damage if unit isn’t handled with care.
pros: Very good charging output for its size
Works well, even in partly cloudy conditions
Very lightweight and easy to set up in different configurations (even just using tape in some cases)
cons: Panel surface collects dust and is hard to clean
Panel can be damaged if moved around frequently, making it impossible to use on hiking trips
MC4 connectors can break somewhat easily

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Placed it on top of my SUV to run evaporation cooling fans and charge my jump-start battery while idle.
customer_reviews.author: VS

customer_reviews.title: Good panel, but shade kills it's output
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but contrary to other reviewer's comments, it does not have bypass diodes, and if even a single cell is covered in shade the whole solar panel becomes almost worthless, dropping from 3.5-4a of current down to 0.2-0.4a current, even while 90% of the panel is still in direct sunlight.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Zehm

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Mine cracked straight across in two places at around the six month mark. What they don't tell you about this panel is that it should be mounted and left. I used it around my travel trailer without a stand since I felt it should be sturdy enough for outdoor use under different conditions. I really wanted to love this panel. Not sure I would purchase one like this again. Too susceptible to being damaged,
customer_reviews.author: Eileen J. Glick

customer_reviews.title: Less than a week in the sun and problems already starting.
customer_reviews.text: Had high hopes for this when I bought it. Top clear layer is already delaminating from the solar cells. I have had it in the sun for less than a week. Only a matter of time before moisture finds a way in and shorts cells. I have only seen 60W peak output and that is in ideal conditions. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Baxter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. Spectacular support. Install properly.
customer_reviews.text: This is a spectacular design. And the customer service is spectacular. Best I've seen in my 67 years. Panels like these are extremely vulnerable to flexing and possibly to any electrical spikes. Make certain to install on an inflexible surface and use diode protection. I've never seen a company with more integrity. Well done Suaoki.
customer_reviews.author: Loving

customer_reviews.title: Works well, power output as expected.
customer_reviews.text: I've had these mounted on my van for a couple of months now and they're working great. They have had no problem keeping my 12v/100Ah battery charged, even during days with mix clouds while running my mini fridge and a laptop. Update: Over a year old and still going great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cool concept but the quality just isnt there
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these panels for a camping trip and was able to generate a max of 9.5 amp hours @ 13.5 volts using my PWM Solar Charge controller or about 70% of the rated max capacity. Within 24 hours of using them for the first time, one of the panels developed ripples/bubbles across 2-3 of the cells for no apparent reason and my max generated amps dropped to 5-6 for the rest of the trip. Cool concept but the quality just isnt there. The design needs improvement
customer_reviews.author: Mantis

customer_reviews.title: I have installed 2 of these panels on the T-top of my boat center console
customer_reviews.text: I have installed 2 of these panels on the T-top of my boat center console. They keep my two trolling motors peaked out and ready to run my minn kota Ulterra. In the location I store my boat, I have no access to an electrical outlet. I was having to pull the batteries out every time I went fishing to recharge. I installed these panels and fixed my problem. They keep my batteries at peak performance even when I use the trolling motor day after day. I could not be happier with the panels.
customer_reviews.author: Del

customer_reviews.title: I was very pleased with the initial performance and appearance
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after two weeks. I bought four of these panels and received well packed packages. I was very pleased with the initial performance and appearance. They worked well at first but two panels stopped working after only two weeks. I found that there were bubbles at the front of the panels and burnt marks at the back of the panels. I do not know what is going on, but obviously this is a manufacturing defect.
customer_reviews.author: Zcy

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Company really stands behind their product. Mine was damaged in a hailstorm that smashed windshields and ruined roofs all over Denver. I sent them the panel back and they sent me a new one. Really happy with the panel and I would highly recommend it. Works flat on rv roof even on curved surface. One is enough to keep my battery charged even when I run the heater over night.
customer_reviews.author: Smiths

customer_reviews.title: Using on top my boat
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work good used it on my boat to charge or trolling motor. Seems to put out power even on shady days.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: They just died after 7 months. Suaoki warranty was legit. Stay tuned.
customer_reviews.text: I have four of these installed on my Stryker 2912. They had been working great for about 7 Months. They originally produced 20.3 amps max. I use a go power pwm 30a charge controller to charge two 6v golf cart batteries running in series. Today, (May 31, 2018 they just stopped working all together. I checked voltage and amps with my Klein CL800 Multimeter. Nothing is coming out. Suaoki warranty process was actually not bad given we had entire day delays in communication back forth. New panels on the way after shipping old ones back. Hopefully the new ones last longer than the old ones.
customer_reviews.author: Lee B.

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold up well with some weather.
customer_reviews.text: Had this solar panel since last fall and after a recent hail storm it quit working. There was no other damage to the plastic on the car, RV, or house so it was pretty light. Close inspection indicated small dimples in the solar panel and now its just dead. If your looking for a flexible solar panel keep this in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Completely stopped producing power. ...
customer_reviews.text: Solar panels worked as described when they were new. Less than a year later stopped working completely, I hate that I wasted over $700 buying 6 of these panels. Installed them in Far West Texas on a building in a rural area, came back to find all my batteries were drain down because no power was coming in. My rigid solar panels purchase from another company work just fine still, only the flexible solar panels have failed.
customer_reviews.author: simon p.

customer_reviews.title: Installed with VHB tape on the top of a van ...
customer_reviews.text: Installed with VHB tape on the top of a van. Attractive, but died just after the one year anniversary of purchase. Also, plastic layer on top of the cells has started delaminating, so optical quality might suffer. However, despite being a couple days past the 1 year anniversary, they offered to replace the panel and restart the 1 year warranty, so upgrading two stars. Will update if this one has issues.
customer_reviews.author: Edward W. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Maybe they will improve these with time...
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after about 6 months use...probably due to flexing. I went back to panels that have a frame.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light and flexible, I saved the shipping box to store it in the RV when on the road.
customer_reviews.text: This was for adding solar charging to my RV's house battery bank. The panel is light and flexible so it can go up on the roof, the roll out awning or on a 20' cable out from under the trees to full sun although it was producing in partial shade.
customer_reviews.author: LatitudeAdjustment

customer_reviews.title: Delaminating
customer_reviews.text: Bought these panels they were good till about a month ago they started peeling apart. I have them ontop of my deck and they are peeling a coat of lamentation already.
customer_reviews.author: Tiny Living

customer_reviews.title: One of my two panels is only outputting 10-11volts after ...
customer_reviews.text: One of my two panels is only outputting 10-11volts after less than 2 months. Will be contacting manufacturer to see if they can help. Update 24Dec2017 Customer support has been real good. They are quick to respond through email and I have replaced a panel so far. It may take 2 weeks for the replacement to arrive but that's fine.
customer_reviews.author: Gundam1s

customer_reviews.title: A must have for RV
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two 100w panels and have been using to top off RV batteries. I must admit both panels worked better than I had expected during our last long dry camping trip. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: fvzone

customer_reviews.title: Nicely put together panel that lies flat on the roof ...
customer_reviews.text: Nicely put together panel that lies flat on the roof of my rover. Nicely packaged. Combined with my other 100w panel pulling nearly 11.5 amps with some of the panel shaded. It's pricier than solid aluminum panels but the weight difference is nice, much easier to handle and place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: failed after a few years
customer_reviews.text: protective uv film peeled off after 2 years (panel is mounted to a hard surface and never flexed) and now its completely clouded over and not producing anywhere near the power it did before.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Flexible but fragile.
customer_reviews.text: After about six months of occasional use, the panel voltage fell by half. I think a lead broke somewhere inside the panel. Beware: It may be 'semi-flexible', but it's also pretty fragile. Don't move or flex it more than you absolutely have to.
customer_reviews.author: SlappyTheFrog

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got it.
customer_reviews.text: Both plugs snapped in the first week. Brittle plastic MC4 connectors. But it is a champ other than that. It works great and is tough and portable. I recommend it. Probably a bad batch of MC4 plugs that I got.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Tepool

customer_reviews.title: They do the job
customer_reviews.text: Installed on my Airstream Flying Cloud 23D and love them. Low profile, they add a little to the overall look of my rig. Fulltiming in Washington, I don't get hardly anything in the winter, but in the spring and summers, I have more electricity in my batteries than I can even use! Thanks for the amazing value, Suaoki!
customer_reviews.author: Private User

customer_reviews.title: Does not last
customer_reviews.text: Bought a couple of these to mount semi-permanently on my van. Worked great for about a year. After that one of them started bubbling all over and stopped working, only a few weeks after the warranty expired. Contacted the manufacturer and they were kind enough to give me half my money back on the dead panel. Two months later, the other one had the same problem. Do not buy these panels, they won’t last.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin B Broer

customer_reviews.title: Measured power at 2. 1 amps on 21 volts ...
customer_reviews.text: Measured power at 2.1 amps on 21 volts (44 watts) laying flat on ground. Pointed at Sun power was 5.1 amps on 21 volts (107 watts). Sun angle was about 42 degrees at 2:40pm. Will be using Blue Solar Victron 75/15 controller on primary battery (Optima 27F Yellow). Eventually will be going dual battery. Using setup for ARB Fridge.
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased three of these panels in 2016 and after two years of use they have hazed over and are functioning at 50% capacity. After numerous emails and platitudes the company has refused to replace the panels stating they were out of warranty and have a nice day. Solar panels should last much longer then 4 years. Pass this one by.
customer_reviews.author: pelagicsailor

customer_reviews.title: Work great but starting to crack after 18 months
customer_reviews.text: These are great, but I went to move them today and they started to crack when I moved them. Not sure if I lost a cell or if there is a break, they seem to still work. I will contact SUAOKI to see if I can get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great and very portable, I even bought a second one because I was so impressed.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: great alternative to a my 100 watt hard panel
customer_reviews.text: Wow, great alternative to a my 100 watt hard panel. slim fit has many uses. very durable. Mounted with straps to the top of my RTT to power national luna fridgefreeze...
customer_reviews.author: Mark M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Panels!
customer_reviews.text: I use these as deployable panels with our camper van. They run on a 30 foot tether and charge a 155ah AGM battery via a 30A charge controller. Durable, light....everything you want in a flexible panel.
customer_reviews.author: GOTT

customer_reviews.title: Suaoki is an excellent Solar panel charger!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product to recharge the Suaoki powerhouse and the Poweroak. It is flexible and can be hung on a fence or placed on a flat surface in direct sunlight. It is light enough to place on the roof or hood of your car and attached to the solar powerhouse to be recharged. The Suaoki powerhouse and the poweroak come with connectors made specifically to be used with the 100W Suaoki 12v solar panel charger. I have heavier solar panels mounted on aluminum frames and I much prefer the Suaoki 100W for portability both due to its excellent rating in converting solar energy to DC power and its lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: R. Alford

customer_reviews.title: Still working.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 4 panels and they are still working but one panel has the clear plastic protective coating peeling off the face in less than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Light & durable panel
customer_reviews.text: Very light but durable panel, I can easily move them around with one arm. Came double boxed. For portability the extra cost for these panels are the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product at a good price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product at a good price. I have two of these panels and would recommend them to anyone. Suaoki is a great company to work with and they are very responsive to inquiries.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper1972

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Failed in less than one year of part time use
customer_reviews.author: Bill. -Bills Toy Shop Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. I installed it on my camper and ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I installed it on my camper and it charges my camper battery at a great rate even on cloudy days.
customer_reviews.author: Frans Andrea

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: As expected. Looks to be very durable. Pleased with it...
customer_reviews.author: John perry

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: This panel is garbage! I used it on the top of my RV and it didn't even last me a year of very moderate use.
customer_reviews.author: Chris O.

customer_reviews.title: 3 years still going strong
customer_reviews.text: Installed it in my van almost 3 years back. Still putting out the good volts.
customer_reviews.author: yeah man

customer_reviews.title: Great deal on sale.
customer_reviews.text: Easy install on travel trailer. Seems to work great as battery charger. No need to leave rig plugged in any more.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Suaoki 100W 18V 12V Solar Panel
customer_reviews.text: This is the key component of optional power for my 1970, 16ft. Forester Kayot Camper.
customer_reviews.author: Buck50

customer_reviews.title: Portable and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this panel to charge Aeiusny Backup battery pack for hurricane season. Works well in Florida sun Charged battery pack fully in 4 hrs. Good for condo as lightweight and portable. Additional MC4 adapter connector required to charge my battery pack
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works and is light and thin.charges their battery box too
customer_reviews.author: Theodore S Brahms

customer_reviews.title: Work great for my needs,  Only paid $175
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my needs. Got mine for $175 not sure why the price jumped up so much since the day I purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: TheManWithNoName

customer_reviews.title: 100% failure rate after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these and 2 years later every one of them has failed, if they ever come back on Amazon do not buy them!!!
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Bought in Sept 2017. Deployed April 2018 from the ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought in Sept 2017. Deployed April 2018 from the box. Worked for one month. Now no power output. Not reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Dad

customer_reviews.title: worked one day
customer_reviews.text: was in full sun and after one day was only putting out 9 watts only sometimes
customer_reviews.author: Simone Horne

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great high quality product, the flexible design works well on a curved RV roof.
customer_reviews.author: Rex

customer_reviews.title: They worked great until they started to delaminate and then crack apart
customer_reviews.text: I have had 4 of these on the roof of my rv for 13 months now. One has stopped working. It is completly dried out and cracked apart. The other three are in the process of doing the same. They worked great until they started to delaminate and then crack apart. For the price you pay for these, they should last longer than a year.
customer_reviews.author: FRED

customer_reviews.title: wish they were still for sale
customer_reviews.text: one working 4 yrs one bad out of box best over all wattage output
customer_reviews.author: patrick a brooks

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was fast quality product works as expected very satisfied😎
customer_reviews.author: anthony souza

customer_reviews.title: Quality.
customer_reviews.text: High quality with excellent output. I use 3 to keep my house and starter batteries fully charged. A total of 9 batteries!
customer_reviews.author: Arizona Rattler

customer_reviews.title: Ready to Return
customer_reviews.text: The panel was really soft and lightweight. I was happy about it until I tested at a sunny day afternoon. The output was only 2.1Amp.
customer_reviews.author: acustomer1

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: We installed this on our van, attaching it to a dual battery charger. One lead goes to the van's battery, the other to our camper's battery. The installation was very low profile, exposing very little surface area to the van's slipstream. The lighter weight vs. a glass panel was a big plus, as was the significantly lower cost. It may not last as long as a glass panel, but for our purposes it is likely to be sufficient as long as we are likely to have our van. Having this has solved a couple of big (and expensive) battery problems for us.
customer_reviews.author: P. Malone

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight 100W solar power
customer_reviews.text: The Suaoki 100W solar panel puts out a decent 4 plus amps to a battery in bright sunlight (over 5 amps across panel outputs). Grommets in corners and sides allow easy mounting/tie down if needed. Lightweight and durable construction makes it very portable and storable, perfect for smaller RV applications.
customer_reviews.author: Beemers

customer_reviews.title: didn't work but they gave me a refund
customer_reviews.text: I bought a panel earlier this spring in preparation for a big road trip in my van. About a month into using it full time, it just stopped working. Customer service worked with me to send a new one but that one stoppped working as well. Returned for full refund. 3 stars since it didn't work but customer service was responsive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent panels with great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: This panel works really well. I've been using them when boondocking to charged my trailer batteries and they have been through some pretty tough wind, dust and rain and still work great. The only thing I found was that the connector could break if not properly secured. You better set these up properly to make sure they stay in good working order. I had a problem with one of my connector and the company was kind enough to offer me a replacement right away. Excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.author: David Couillard

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Well made item. Mounted two 100 w panels flat on my RV roof which is a comprised instillation for maximal output. However, just one week after the Spring Equinox in NC, they produced 11 amps (132) volts at noon which promptly recharged my RV coach batteries. An excellent item at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Bought second unit great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this panel 14 months ago and it worked fine with no problems until recently. It started reading very low to zero volts output.Not sure what the problem was. I use it to charge my house battery on my RV. I was ready to go buy another unit but decided to contact customer service. They were great. They asked for pictures of the unit, and volt readings. They responded to my emails within 24 hours. They issued a full refund including return shipping costs. I then ordered the same unit and it is functioning perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect and on time. Will order a another panel for boat. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: It's only been a week but this solar panel is giving us great input throughout the day, even with clouds. Doesn't work well when the sun is just coming up or going down, but I believe that's normal.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Swartz

customer_reviews.title: I was very pleased with the prompt and professional customer service.
customer_reviews.text: The output voltage of this panel after six months of use has dropped to 15.6 V in full sun. It is not enough to trigger my MPPT controller. I am very disappointed and I would like to return it. The Customerservice was great and prompt. We reached a mutual understanding. I would consider buying from them again.
customer_reviews.author: DEL

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 and received one working panel. no shipping damage, just plain defective
customer_reviews.author: Jim P

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, light weight
customer_reviews.text: Great Product, light weight, fairly flexible, no "glass" - so I can pack it in my camper and not worry about it cracking.... when combined with the solar controller - works great.
customer_reviews.author: Constantine M.

customer_reviews.title: Fine Product
customer_reviews.text: It works just fine. I have it installed for a second week already, seems working flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Polar Tiger

customer_reviews.title: Wooooowe Place it eases on the top of my camper ...
customer_reviews.text: Wooooowe Place it eases on the top of my camper van Having free electricity all the day to run my fans and light and many other stuff
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: This product is awesome, easily charged our trailer batteries
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome, easily charged our trailer batteries, in a short matter of time, lightweight. The upgraded controller may be better but the suggested works good enought.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted one year.  Now only puts out about 9 volts
customer_reviews.text: Noticed solar cells are not straight on the white plastic backing. 1 year update: Stopped working, only about 9 volts now.
customer_reviews.author: Lorne V. Serpa

customer_reviews.title: Cold soldered junction box, MC4 connector cheap plastic. .
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a year. Lightweight. – One connector inside the junction box was cold soldered and started failing in under 6 months. I noticed a problem, but didn't believe that their solar panel was to blame, so didn't think to check. Now I have a better panel, and everything is back to normal fast charging. – After two years the plastic on the male of their solar panel MC4 Connectors going into the connecting adaptor snapped off at its own neck next to the o-ring inside. Cheap plastic MC4 connectors. = Connectors on front. This may or may not be what you want.
customer_reviews.author: University Headmaster

customer_reviews.title: needs better MC4 connectors
customer_reviews.text: The panel itself seems to be working, with a short test plugged into my Goal Zero, but the MC4 connectors attached to this panel are awful. I have several things with MC4 connectors (at least two different brands), and these are the only ones that are absolutely impossible to disconnect with fingers, without tools. And the one plug is even very difficult to get snapped in. I emailed the seller...
customer_reviews.author: jmr

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This works great! Mounted it to the roof of the RV and will keep the batteries charged.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value! More wattage at 1/8 the weight of my old solar panels!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Brady

customer_reviews.title: The Suaoki bendable solar panel
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this lightweight panel and use it in several applications, charging my battery bank, keeping my vehicles batteries charged, and it will be with me while traveling /camping. It's better than I expected. Great item. I recommend it. Did I mention it is lightweight?
customer_reviews.author: Sissy

customer_reviews.title: Bendable is more than generous when describing this item. ...
customer_reviews.text: Bendable is more than generous when describing this item. It does technically bend, but it can not make angles, or bend in specific areas. Might as well sold it as inflexible, then you could pleasantly surprise someone.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Its good.
customer_reviews.text: Im gettimg over 35 watts with the sun high in the sky, and the build quality is high. I could only read 35 watts off my system because the battery was full and i only pull 35 watts. Its probably alot more. I was getting 15 watts in the morning with the sun low.
customer_reviews.author: Bodewah

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: First time solar user -- worked surprisingly well, dont for get controlelr since this puts out 18V. Need to work out how to up convert to 36V dc fro charging my golf cart
customer_reviews.author: KT in AZ

customer_reviews.title: ... out the power 50ft and put out 22 watts great would buy
customer_reviews.text: This thing will put out the power 50ft and put out 22 watts great would buy again
customer_reviews.author: doug

customer_reviews.title: I bought this one so that I can hook up ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one so that I can hook up with Goal zero yeti 1000 from costco, waiting for two adapter for Amazon, will test it on next trip,
customer_reviews.author: Duc nguyen

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap. It didn't work at all. Horrible customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Globe trotter

customer_reviews.title: Great support.
customer_reviews.text: There was good customer service for this product when it began to perform badly. I am glad to report they stand behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: Alana Aviel

product_meta.title: SUAOKI 100W 18V 12V Solar Panel Charger SunPower Cell Ultra Thin Flexible with MC4 Connector Charging for RV Boat Cabin Tent Car(Compatibility with 18V and Below Devices)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.1 out of 5 stars146 ratings3.1 out of 5 stars
